title: The President of India
simplifiedText: India shall have a President who is the head of the country. The President is like the captain of a ship - they represent the nation!
funFact: The President lives in Rashtrapati Bhavan, which has 340 rooms!

title: Executive Power of the Union
simplifiedText: The President holds all executive power of India. But like a wise ruler, they work through the Prime Minister and Council of Ministers.
funFact: The President can pardon death sentences!

title: Election of President
simplifiedText: The President is elected by an Electoral College - special voters who are elected members of Parliament and State Legislatures.
funFact: The election uses a special voting system called Single Transferable Vote!

title: Council of Ministers
simplifiedText: The Prime Minister leads a team called the Council of Ministers who help run the country. The President acts on their advice.
funFact: The Cabinet meets at least once a week to discuss important matters!

title: Prime Minister Appointment
simplifiedText: The President appoints the Prime Minister, who is usually the leader of the party with most seats. Other ministers are appointed on PM's advice.
funFact: India has had 14 Prime Ministers since independence!

title: Constitution of Parliament
simplifiedText: Parliament has two houses: Lok Sabha (House of People) and Rajya Sabha (Council of States), along with the President.
funFact: The Parliament building took 6 years to build and was inaugurated in 1927!

title: Rajya Sabha Composition
simplifiedText: Rajya Sabha has up to 250 members - 238 elected by State Assemblies and 12 nominated by President for their expertise.
funFact: Rajya Sabha is called the "Upper House" and never fully dissolves!

title: Lok Sabha Composition
simplifiedText: Lok Sabha can have up to 552 members directly elected by citizens. Each member represents about 16-18 lakh people!
funFact: Lok Sabha is called the "Lower House" but it's actually more powerful in money matters!

title: Voting in Parliament
simplifiedText: Decisions in Parliament are made by majority vote. If there's a tie, the Speaker or Chairman casts the deciding vote!
funFact: The Speaker rarely votes to maintain impartiality!

title: How Laws are Made
simplifiedText: A bill (proposed law) must be passed by both Houses of Parliament and get President's assent to become a law.
funFact: Some bills need a special majority of 2/3rd members!

title: Supreme Court of India
simplifiedText: The Supreme Court is the highest court in India with a Chief Justice and other judges. They are the final word on justice!
funFact: The Supreme Court building's design represents the scales of justice!

title: Court of Record
simplifiedText: The Supreme Court keeps records of all its decisions. These records are very important and can be used as evidence.
funFact: Supreme Court judgments become precedents that lower courts must follow!

title: Original Jurisdiction
simplifiedText: The Supreme Court can directly hear disputes between the Union and States, or between States themselves.
funFact: This is like being a referee in disputes between governments!

title: Governor of State
simplifiedText: Each State has a Governor who is like the President at the state level. They are appointed by the President of India.
funFact: A Governor must be at least 35 years old!

title: State Council of Ministers
simplifiedText: The Chief Minister leads the State Council of Ministers who help run the state. The Governor acts on their advice.
funFact: The Chief Minister is like the Prime Minister but for a state!

title: Chief Minister Appointment
simplifiedText: The Governor appoints the Chief Minister, who is usually the leader of the party with most seats in the State Assembly.
funFact: India has had many young Chief Ministers, some in their 30s!

title: State Legislature
simplifiedText: States can have one house (Legislative Assembly) or two houses (with Legislative Council). The Governor is part of it.
funFact: Only 6 states have two houses of legislature!

title: Legislative Assembly
simplifiedText: The Legislative Assembly (Vidhan Sabha) has members directly elected by people. It can have 60 to 500 members.
funFact: UP has the largest Legislative Assembly with 403 members!

title: Legislative Council
simplifiedText: The Legislative Council (Vidhan Parishad) is the upper house. Members are elected indirectly and some are nominated.
funFact: Members include teachers, graduates, and local body representatives!

title: High Courts
simplifiedText: Each State has a High Court which is the highest court in that state. They ensure justice at the state level.
funFact: Calcutta High Court is the oldest in India, established in 1862!

title: Writ Jurisdiction
simplifiedText: High Courts can issue special orders called writs to protect fundamental rights. They are guardians of our rights!
funFact: There are 5 types of writs: Habeas Corpus, Mandamus, Prohibition, Certiorari, and Quo Warranto!

title: Superintendence over Lower Courts
simplifiedText: High Courts supervise all lower courts and tribunals in their jurisdiction. They ensure everyone follows the law.
funFact: High Courts can transfer cases from one lower court to another!
